results.title: Night and day
results.creator_credit: Arthur Schwartz, Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: The spectacular musical biography of one of this century’s greatest composers - Cole Porter. Cary Grant portrays Cole Porter and Night and Day shows the popular songwriter’s amazing life story - from studying law at Yale, his bravery in World War I, his romance with Linda Lee to his first Broadway success. Features the evergreen hit songs “Begin the Beguine”, “I Get a Kick Out of You”, “My Heart Belongs to Daddy” and “Let’s fall in love.” Starring Cary Grant and Alexis Smith. Co-starring Monty Woolley, Ginny Simms, Jane Wyman and Mary Martin.

results.title: Nigeria: giant in Africa
results.brief_description: This vivid recounting of Nigeria’s history, from pre-European times to the mid-20th century, provides dramatic background to the political maturing of Africa’s most populous country. Of particular interest is the film’s treatment of ancient African cultures as revealed in the three regions that make up the Federation of Nigeria.

results.title: Nigeria 1960 - sunrise in the east
results.creator_credit: Andre Libik, Victor M. Gover, British Information Services and Eric Chamberlain
results.brief_description: A survey of eastern Nigeria against a background of Independence celebrations: the region and its people, natural resources and recent developments in industry, agriculture, transport, communications, health and education services.

results.title: Nigeria's University College
results.creator_credit: Nigerian Film Unit and Lionel Snazelle
results.brief_description: This film follows the various stages in the building of the University College at Ibadan, in Nigeria, designed by Jane drew and Maxwell Fry, The British architects, who supervised the work on the spot.

results.title: Nigel Dick interview
results.brief_description:
Nigel Dick discusses how he moved from veterinary science to an advertising cadetship with the “Daily Telegraph”, finally moving into television in 1956 to Channel 9.
Dick talks about the early days of television in Australia; the influence of Arthur Warner, the Royal Commission into television in the 1950’s and it’s ensuing recommendations, the creation of “In Melbourne Tonight” based on the strength of Graeme Kennedy’s personality, and the response from other stations in creating a similar show for Bert Newton, or putting movies against “IMT” in the ratings.
He also discusses the relationship between print media and television, the origins of the channel 7 logo, and the future of television, including cable channels and digitisation.

results.title: Nico the unicorn
results.creator_credit: Julie Allan, Pieter Kroonenburg, Fries/Schultz Film Group, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures and Graeme Campbell
results.brief_description: Based on the popular novel for young adults by Frank Sacks, this drama centres on the adventures of Billy (Kevin Zegers), an 11-year-old boy whose life is shattered after his leg is permanently damaged, and his father is killed, in a car accident involving a drunk driver. Attempting to escape the bad memories of the accident, Billy and his mother Julie (Anne Archer) move to a new town, where, after visiting a rundown circus, they adopt a neglected pregnant pony that is being mistreated by its owner. But this is no ordinary pony. The foal she gives birth is a unicorn with magical powers who transforms Billy’s life. Yet as word spreads about this wonderous animal, Billy is forced muster all his courage to take the steps needed to save it from destruction.

results.title: Nicky: one of my best friends
results.creator_credit: Togg Films, McGraw-Hill Films, Grania Gurievitch and Anthony Jones
results.brief_description: Nicky is a blind boy who also suffers from cerebral palsy. This film shows him at home with his family and at school with his friends. Nicky attends a normal school because his parents feel that he would benefit more by being in the mainstream.

results.title: Nickelodeon
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: Heartfelt valentine to early days of moviemaking, with O’Neal literally stumbling into his job as director, and Reynolds as an overnight screen hero. Before making this tribute to the brilliant, haphazard early days of Hollywood filmmaking, director/screenwriter Peter Bogdanovich interviewed several veteran filmmakers including John Ford, Raoul Walsh, Allan Dwan and Howard Hawks.

results.title: Nicholas Nickleby
results.creator_credit: Sir Michael Balcon, Alberto Cavalcanti and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forever Ealing”.
Features the British film production house Ealing Studios adaptation of the classic tale by Charles Dickens. Stars Derek Bond as Nicholas Nickleby, Sybil Thorndike as Mrs. Squeers, Sir Cedric Hardwicke as the steely hearted uncle and Stanley Holloway as the earthy thespian Vincent Crummels.

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra: war and the fall of the Czar, 1914-1917
results.creator_credit: Sam Spiegel, Franklin J. Schaffner and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Western Civilization”.
Shows the intertwining of Russia’s war policy abroad with her chaos at home. Tells how Nicholas went to the front with the army, leaving Alexandra to rule and how she thought only of her son’s possible cure. Ends with Czar’s abdication. Uses excerpts from the film “Nicholas and Alexandra (1971) starring Michael Jayston, Janet Suzman.
